page.title: 08Transport in Sellindge 1985
page.content: The most common forms of transport used by local residents and visitors to the village are the private motor car or motorcycle.Whilst public transport is provided by the National or East Kent bus companies, busses now run hourly to Ashford and Maidstone or Hythe and Folkestone instead of the 20 minute service of just a few years ago. This is the only daily public transport in the area,apart from the school bus which is only for pupils of Brockhill School.A bus goes to Canterbury and back on Wednesdays and another to Presto supermarket in Folkestone on Fridays,whilst a London bound coach comes through the village twice daily.The nearest railway stations are Westenhangar,over 2 miles away,or Ashford,both of which give access to trains travelling in the London or Folkestone directions.
